parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Check unit rating. Rating is increased for killing enemies, decreased for killing friendlies (see [[ArmA:_Rating Values|Rating Values]]). Can be changed via [[addRating]] by the mission designer. 

The rating of the player is displayed as the "score" at the end of the mission. Via [[Description.ext]] one can define how many points it takes to get a perfect score, as well as the number of stars.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Number]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''rating''' unitName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_score <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''rating''' [[player]] </code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Side relations]], [[ArmA: Rating Values]], [[addRating]], [[rank]], [[setUnitRank]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">Unknown</dt>
<dd class="note">In ArmA 1.18 rating does only return rating levels for units that are local.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
